website_summaries.verdict: With a smaller base than other power towers, this is the one you want if you're short on space.
pros: Handles have grips for nonslip workouts
Made of oblate, reinforced steel frame
Measures 30.7" L x 42.5" W x 84.7" H. Height can be adjusted from 64.6" to 84.6"
cons: If you find the power tower a bit wobbly, try putting a mat under it

customer_reviews.title: The unit was relatively easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: The unit was relatively easy to put together. Study the instructions and you'll be fine - it took me 1.5 hrs to put together. I bought this because I have 8 foot ceilings and really like the fact that this is adjustable. There definitely is a noticeable oily smell that is diminishing pretty quickly. The bottom legs aren't perfectly parallel because they angle in a little, but it shouldn't impact me from using it. Some screws were a little difficult in fitting in the correct spots. The hardware provided was all there. There is a slight wobble for me (at 205 pounds) but it still feels stable. The optimal weight for someone using this is probably up to 160-180 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy space saving unit
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy unit. Works good for what I need. I like the front facing pull up bar because it saves space and can be pushed up against the wall. Also I'm 6'4" and it has adjustable height that fits me. Many of the other units were too short. Only reason for not giving 5 is because there were some scratches on it and evidence it had been put together before.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B.

customer_reviews.title: Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent power tower for the money! I'm a heavy guy at just under 240lbs and this unit has been steady. The only thing for me, being so heavy, is it's just a little wobbly when doing dips, so what I did was place a shelf of weights (kettlebells) on the rear to reinforce stability. I have been using it for about a month and had no problems so far. I highly recommend purchasing this if you are looking for a great power tower for a price that's hard to beat! When assembling, it really helps to have your own tools on hand. It takes about an hour to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Very well built
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today, packed very well, each piece protected, easy to put together with good instructions - just wait until the end to tighten, it is very snug fit. Took about 45 minutes at a leisurely pace. I’m about 240, I jumped on it, it is really study, no noise or anything. I’m probably going to anchor it to the wall just to be safe but highly recommend thus far based on the quality and sturdiest.
customer_reviews.author: Just one more

customer_reviews.title: Agreed - Bad instructions, parts missing
customer_reviews.text: I agree with others that have similar comments. I've assembled many other things - point is it's NOT me, and this ain't rocket science. Parts are missing, parts have such large gaps that you'll need instructions to reference to see if you really are using the right nuts with right bolts, in the right holes etc. Mine came missing about a dozen various nuts. It's already unpacked; what am I going to return it? No, I'll head to Lowes or Home Depot over the weekend and buy some matching nuts and bolts etc. Did I want to spend time doing that? Heck no. I guess this will teach me to spend more.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Worthless...
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a great pull up and dip bar. Since they only included 10 of the 12 "Anti Loosening Nut (aa)"... So until I take a trip to the hardware store (Too much of a hassle to return it).... This is just a $162.99 paperweight. I advise any other similar product.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Diller

customer_reviews.title: Sent with incorrect hardware
customer_reviews.text: It appears the nuts and bolts are prepackaged, so I find it odd that the cross bar lag bolts were completely incorrect. They aren't lag bolts and they're skinny with the suggested compression nuts to tighten being way too big. Plus, the bolts themselves are way too long. I double and triple checked and all the rest of the hardware corresponds, so these 4 bolts are just wrong. Can't put it together, so I'll be returning and buying a competitor.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, wrong parts
customer_reviews.text: This would actually be really easy to assemble--if the construction wasn't so poor and the correct parts were given. I was sent 1 extra carriage bolt and 1 less hex bolt than I needed, and they're not interchangeable. It's a huge pain to try and return such an item especially after it's been unpackaged, so I made do with a quick trip to the hardware store--only to find that the adjustment knob for the top part is also threaded incorrectly, which I can't work around.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I would keep looking, not a good piece of equipment. I am 6 ft, 190 lbs and from the start this thing is wobbling and flimsy, especially doing dips. I started with it on a hardwood floor, then tried on exercise pads, and now I have the bottom bolted to a 3/4 inch thick 32" by 36" inch MDF on exercise pads. I also have some of the same wood bolted across the back supports to limit lateral movement and a number of self tappers holding the top frame rigid and it is still sketchy at best when using it. Might be okay for kids, but I suggest adults keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Good at full height, works at lower height
customer_reviews.text: Nice pull up tower. Total height is adjustable but below a certain height leg ups and power ups become uncomfortable. Good if you don't care about those or have high enough ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Oron

customer_reviews.title: How do other reviews highlight are wrong, it’s wobbly - AND still give it 4 stars???
customer_reviews.text: Parts dont match instructions - which a lot of the 4 star reviews call out How can you rate this thing 5 stars when the parts don’t match instructions - you need to use different screws in different places And it’s wobbly!
customer_reviews.author: L. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Was given the wrong instructions. Bolts don’t fit into a couple of the holes. Worst product I ever bought on Amazon. Lastly there were metal shards that came out of mine (see pictures). My daughter stepped on one and her foot started to bleed.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: this is sturdy and meant for people less than 200lbs
customer_reviews.text: I am a 23 y/o girl, who weighs 130lbs. this is sturdy and meant for people less than 200lbs, unless you put it on a hard surface. mine is on the carpet. it does have a mild machine smell when you put it together, it smells of oil and parts, completely understandable, and will air away. this is not an issue at all. this product took me 2.5 hours to put together alone with no help. the instructors were very easy to use i thought. for the price, this is an awesome deal.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Vandal

customer_reviews.title: UNSAFE AND WILL TOBBLE OVER
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed ☹️. I had such high hopes to getting back in shape and feeling better. The stand is very wobbly it is unsafe. I lost my balance at the dips on it with the pull-ups just so unsafe. I didn't let my daughter use it I was so scard. I hope people read this review I don't want anyone getting hurt like I did. Terrible. If you must use it never be alone just in case.
customer_reviews.author: de s.

customer_reviews.title: Worst Instructions ever
customer_reviews.text: This product has the worst instructions ever, the screws were not even matching with the instructions. When I had placed a few parts together I had to unassemble it again because the instructions told me to use the wrong screws.
customer_reviews.author: Adniel C.

customer_reviews.title: There are better products out there
customer_reviews.text: Product came timely and undamage with all parts and sufficient instructions necessary for assembly. Unfortunately that’s where the good ends. After assembling it and placing it on a flat surface I found that it wobbled. This is slightly distracting for leg raises all pull ups but they can be done with minimal distraction.....the real problem are the dips. I’m 6’3” 200 and I could not do a single dip without this thing tipping over to save my life. I have to weigh it down to make it happen. It’s not the end of the world but it’s also my least favorite part of my home gym
customer_reviews.author: C. P. Belcore

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of exercise equipment
customer_reviews.text: I received it a few days earlier than expected and all the parts were individually wrapped so it came with no scratches. It was fairly simple to assemble and the way they package the screws,washers and nuts was the best system I’ve ever seen. It’s definitely a great piece of workout equipment and I suggest it. Also the pull up bar can be set much lower than I thought it would making it great for a room with low ceilings.
customer_reviews.author: Andy!

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to a home gym
customer_reviews.text: Product is well-constructed, very sturdy & stable, and actually looks pretty good as a part of a home gym. Assembly was straightforward, but is MUCH easier if you use your own tools (2 crescent or box-end wrenches, or sockets...metric size). I had a bit of trouble attaching the arm & back pads to the frame because of wood shavings in the threaded inserts, but they’re easily cleaned with a small knife blade. Some people have noted either an odor or oily surfaces after unboxing but I didn’t detect either issue. I’m over 6’ tall & with the highest extension on the frame, I can do pull-ups with only a slight knee bend (which I think you should do anyway).
customer_reviews.author: Abbye Speaks

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Spent a little more to get this one (over some others that were rated for a lower weight limit). Glad I did as this is very strong and steady. It can still wobble a little, but not enough to be concerned that it could tip.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lesser

customer_reviews.title: Need Missing Pieces to complete assembling
customer_reviews.text: Assembling main parts easy but couldn't finish assembling due to missing a lot of parts/pieces (need 6 anti loose nuts aa, 4 out six angle screws cc, 2 outer six angle screws dd, and 4 anti loose nuts ii). Sturdiness okay but not fully assembled for use. Trying to reach out to company to send me the nuts and bolts to complete my assembling of exercise equipment for use.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lozada-Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a heavy or big girl, but this machine is so slender you must be a child to use it. It arrived pretty quickly, but with pieces missing... so I can’t even put it together properly. Directions are not the best, but if I had all the pieces I could figure it out. Ultimately, don’t waste your time and money
customer_reviews.author: Alexa Vessels

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t tell how it will be, it’s missing pieces so I can’t even put it together! I suspect it’ll be ok if I can get it assembled, though not the sturdiest ever, probably fine for me (5’7" and 160lb) Edit: put it together after having some help from my local hardware store since seller never responded. It’s.... not very sturdy. It feels like it will tip over (and has almost tipped). I probably need to get some sand bags to weight the bottom and it’ll be a bit better, but I’m very concerned to even try tricep dips on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully this review will be helpful for others
customer_reviews.text: My weight is more than 178lb but this power tower has no problems with my weight it doesn't wobble even thought i jump or whatever i think its very strong and good for this price actually when i purchased it i compared with other power tower and choose this one now im very satisfied besides it wasnt that hard to assemble my english is not that good i only followed the pictures in the manual and i had no problems to do it and it took only lesser than 40mins. I will upload some pics as well just in case it will helpful for other people who wants to purchase this power tower
customer_reviews.author: ILHAK KIM

customer_reviews.title: Decent Addition to our gym
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I really like this piece of equipment when we use it in a gym. When we saw this online we had to buy it! It eliminates the need for a pull up bar in the doorway as well as taking a little space. The arms are a little too wide b however. And it is just slightly unstable. Nothing to fear I believe but nonetheless there is movement when the exercises are performed.
customer_reviews.author: David Hughes

customer_reviews.title: A little Wobbly at first but added a mat under ...
customer_reviews.text: A little Wobbly at first but added a mat under it fixed the issue
customer_reviews.author: kevin ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good product for the money. Had a little trouble putting it together. One of the plastic sleeves in the extension tube was broken but I got it together.
customer_reviews.author: John Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Functional, poor instructions, missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Just received this item and put it together yesterday. First, the packaging was in bad shape and barely still together. Fortunately nothing was damaged. The instructions are poorly written and in at least one step you are instructed to use the wrong bolts. By the way, the terms used to describe parts are just silly. Nuts were missing so I had to scrounge through my toolbox to make something work. I also had to grind down some welds on the handle bars so they would slide fully into the support bar. If you are not handy, you might want to look for something else. Functionally, I think will work well for my son's workouts.
customer_reviews.author: hrdames

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, compact, and solid, but also smelly!
customer_reviews.text: Received the box in pretty bad shape. It looked beat up and was coming apart at the seams. But the contents were packaged well and survived whatever the box went through. Assembly took 1.5 hours. Would have been quicker if the instructions were not so terrible. Fortunately it's not brain surgery so the bad instructions were only a minor inconvenience. My biggest gripe is that the item smells like paint or acetone. It's a very strong odor. I have it in the garage and I'm hoping the smell will dissipate eventually. Other than that I'm pleased with the equipment. It's sturdy and compact. Will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: BT Prime

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Wrong screws were provided (did not have 4 Outer Six Angle Screws). So, Anti Loose Nut provided also didn't fit. Was able to attach both feet, then couldn't attach cross bar. No contact info in the pack or instruction booklet, so basically too bad for the fool that purchases the item. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: taszar96

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted and more stable than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It is very stable and was easy to assemble. Take your time threading the bolts that hold on the forearm pads and be careful not to over tighten them. The hand grips for dips are slightly adjustable. After you get the frame level to the floor(my cement floor is not level, so I had to shim the feet slightly), then put a level on the hand grips before tightening them up so they're the same distance off the floor. Like other reviewers have said, don't tighten anything until the whole thing is together, it's easier to align everything and then shore up the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: This Pull-up Stand Sets Up Easily & Works Great !
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this product but the reviews were good so I ordered it through Amazon. It arrived quickly and I had it set up in less than an hour. I have now been using this 4 times a week during my P90X workouts and it is durable, steady and gets the job done ! It is very affordable and the instructions for set up are easy to follow. Nice product !
customer_reviews.author: TF&HMachine

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware
customer_reviews.text: It was dangerous to use this item. Many parts were not aligned, so I couldn’t assemble correctly. Plus Screw sizes were not correct..... I’m not heavy so maybe ok. But not for heavy people. It is scary to use. The power might be collapsed. Screws were missing. Hardware were rusted. The seller was not helpful, but amazon helped me professionally.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Power tower
customer_reviews.text: Captains chair is very solid and well built. No flexing at all. Tower came in a well packaged box. Did not move around at all in box. Instructions were easy to follow and assembly was straight forward. They included basic tool but easier if you have wrenches or socket set.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jankovits

customer_reviews.title: Good but better if top part anchored
customer_reviews.text: It's good but not sturdy enough to stand alone and be fully stable. I used the height adjustment holds to screw in some wood panels that were anchored to a wall. Now it's nice and firm.
customer_reviews.author: zeus sevilla

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tower, it was relatively easy to assemble, and very sturdy even on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a pretty solid pull up bar. There were one or two discrepancies with the instructions, but if you have any sort of common sense, you can figure out what bolts go to which part. Took me about 45 minutes to set up completely. I saw some people complaining about the packaging with the hardware and the instructions. I too had the same issues but it's really not a big deal or difficult to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Jake O.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and compact
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and compact. I have it set up in my office in case I got a chance to work out. Height adjustable is a plus. I am 5'7 159lbs and it works perfectly. Took one star off because the rubber smell is pretty bad and it smells toxic. It has been 3 days now and I think it starts to fade away a bit. If it doesn't, I'll prolly just take the rubber parts off.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Christmas, and the estimated delivery was for January 3rd and it got to my house December 29th I'm very happy with how quick the company sent me my package. Also to put it together it was a breeze, the instructions are perfectly laid out and the peices nicely marked. The tools to put it together come in the package but if you have a simple tool box it would make it a little easier. To summarize I would totally recommend this to anyone for the price and for what it is 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk,not surprised
customer_reviews.text: The whole system wobbles,it’s way too small and I’m short person,this machine is meant more for a toddler,the hardware is cheap and not labeled correctly,the back rest has a downward angle making it really uncomfortable to do leg raises in,your elbow sink right thru the thin pads to the medal and I’m 175lbs,just a cheap machine all around,I would recommend spending the money for a good one
customer_reviews.author: wesley pultz

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the price point
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and great quality for the price. My husband weighs about 220 points and this machine works well for him. Please note that for added security, we added (2) 50 pound sand bags to each side of the machine so that it doesn't tip when in use.
customer_reviews.author: cheney

customer_reviews.title: Some damage on arrival, but made it work
customer_reviews.text: The rubbber grommets that hold the upper and lower uprights together came damaged. I had to reshape them so the upper uprights would slide in to the lower uprights. Other than that, the equipment has worked well. When the upper up rights are at the highest setting I do notice the structure leans forward a bit, but does not feel like it will tip. I have tried to make it tip and it is not easy. Fast shipping, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Freddo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Unable to complete assembling product as it is missing more than half of the hardware. Would have to disassemble an hours worth of assembling to repackage and return so I Contacted amazon to request hardware. Unfortunately they were unable to do so because the manufacturer offers to send hardware free of charge. So was given a number to call, placed on a long hold and then disconnected. Already too frustrated to continue this process. Would like to know what my options are at this point....
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Pattakos

customer_reviews.title: Works good. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Its gets the job done. I got this to hang from the bar for my rotator cuff rehab. It works really well for it and it doesn't take up too much room. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Nowayjose

customer_reviews.title: This piece is effective. It is not "big gym" ...
customer_reviews.text: This piece is effective. It is not "big gym" material but it has a small footprint so I use it at home.
customer_reviews.author: thegoodsister

customer_reviews.title: Parts didn’t manufacture correctly
customer_reviews.text: It’s not easy to assemble if the knob doesn’t screw in to this part where it’s stripped? So now, can’t finish putting this machine together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what I want, but it has a weird ...
customer_reviews.text: Does what I want, but it has a weird smell from the packaging even months later and could be a bit more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Carter

customer_reviews.title: Shotty design!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product, but the assembly infuriated me. It had potential to be very easy to put together, but the nuts included did not fit some bolts. Then the next problem I ran into was trying to align the bolt into the holes that are pre-drilled. The holes did not align and I couldn’t put the dip handle bars on. Obviously a HUGE flaw in the design and no way to get around it unless you have the capabilities to weld new holes into metal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a quality dip station. No complaints. FYI, The oil smell is most likely just from the nuts and bolts. Wash them with degreaser or even dish soap and water.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bellezza

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this because they don't care if you get the right pieces
customer_reviews.text: it doesn't include the right pieces the package for all the parts was torn open and things were dumped all over the bottom of the box by the time I got it I don't care whose fault it is but it's ridiculous and I can't put it together
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How the machine would withstand body weight.
customer_reviews.text: Self maintenance. It was missing a few pertinet screws. But it was replaced within 2 days and the return was free with a drop off to UPS.
customer_reviews.author: Genevia Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Poor assembly instructions.
customer_reviews.text: The nuts, bolts, and screws are all labeled incorrectly and inconsistently on the instructions and packaging. It made assembly more of a puzzle and quite time consuming. But, once I got it together, it’s pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Item is fine for price paid, only problem are the instructions and screws! They are incorrect! We had to take a trip down to Home Depot just to get extra material to put it together. Defeated the purpose of buying online.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Customer service
customer_reviews.text: I had a bit of trouble assembling the product, there were some screws that didn’t fit, it could’ve of been I made a mistake that I made while assembling and reading the instructions. The customer service was very helpful and when I told them the issue I had they went ahead and told me what parts do I need to finish assembling the product. Right now I’m waiting for the extra parts that they are sending me right now, after I get the parts I’ll see how the machine holds up to me, I’m 6,1 225 lbs so I’m a little bit but we will see stay tuned
customer_reviews.author: Mahdi M Taha

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Pull up bars work great as long as ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Pull up bars work great as long as they are at full height. If you need to lower them, you might bump into the lower bars. Heavy duty construction and a versatile piece of gym equipment.
customer_reviews.author: RIppy

customer_reviews.title: Very well built
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. After a year of regular use it's still perfect.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Compact but bad smell from the padding and rubber handles.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: ehh
customer_reviews.text: honestly you get what you pay for. I had to return the first one because none of the parts fit and on the second one half the screw dont get in. Very unstable. Luckily im not very heavy so its fine for me but it almost falls over when my bf gets on it.
customer_reviews.author: maddy muhlsteff

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy again. They give you the wrong parts. Crappily made, nothing fits together. Just not good.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas tomasello

customer_reviews.title: Instructions were incorrect
customer_reviews.text: The assembly of this had it's challenges because the instructions on which bolts went where, were wrong. Its was frustrating, but after we figured out where the correct bolts went, it was easy assembly from there. No issues with this equipment once assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Breg

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more and get something better
customer_reviews.text: The product works and does its job. But wobbles and doesnt fit flat on the floor. There are no adjustable feet to stabilize. Also be careful on how tight you tighten the bolts. It will bend the frame.
customer_reviews.author: ty atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Super unsafe!
customer_reviews.text: Very Unstable! Not built for a Man. I return it 4wks ago still no refund. Really BAD costumer service
customer_reviews.author: Jon L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husbdand to workout. He is about 180lb and 5'7. The tower is able to handle his weigh without any issue. It makes it easier for him because he can use it anytime. It is a good out for the arm muscle as well as abs.
customer_reviews.author: lynn

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Great for dips and pullups. Nice having one at home to use when you feel like it. Would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Dandvic

customer_reviews.title: Important - ainfox has screws mislabeled and 2 nuts are in a separate bag
customer_reviews.text: The screws labeled ee and dd are mislabeled and the instructions have the wrong pictures of the screws. Plus the 2 of the 12 bolts are located in the bag with the handle bolts. See picture - 10 nuts but it says there are 12 Onto the product - no major smell, barely oily and you can wipe it down with a paper towel. I highly doubt it can hold 550 pounds max but it holds 200 pounds enough. If you have control on your movements, it works fine. If you are a bit wobbly in your form, it will wobble. I suggest placing a weight at the base on each side to help with stability.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Good bang for your buck. My only complaint is that it is a bit wobbly. I plan to buy some sandbags to weight down the feet. Besides that, it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Montag

customer_reviews.title: it is 27 inches wide, not 42.5
customer_reviews.text: Will work fine, is sturdy enough, easy to assemble, of note, I chose this frame as it was noted to be 42 inches wide, so would fit around our treadmill, however, it is only 27 inches wide outside to outside.
customer_reviews.author: familyof8

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with all the pieces..
customer_reviews.text: After it arrived & was starting to do assembly I noticed there was not enough nuts for each size screw. An example of this would be Anti Loose nut (aa) does not fit Outer Six Angle screw (dd). So I was missing 4 bolts. Not to mention (dd) is supposed to only be partially threaded. Mine were threaded all the way to the end.. basically I got 6 (ff) screws instead of 2. & 0 (dd) screws.
customer_reviews.author: ForCharlie

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Met my expectations for the price, assembly was easy but use your own tools makes assembly a lot faster, the only reason I am not giving five stars is that the bar rocks forward when doing pull ups, I am 6'3 225, so it almost tipped, I added some dumbbells for counter weight and it works fine. The feet need to be a little longer to help with the stability, but outside of that it's been a good product.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: Wrong screws, impossible to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box, tried to assemble it, after I spent half an hour working on the bottom, I found that they didn’t give me the correct screws, and I couldn’t even find the ones on the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Crap!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and squeaky. No matter how tight I screw the screws it makes terrible noises. Falls forward often. I wraith 215... not a very well built apparatus!
customer_reviews.author: Russell Roosevelt

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy people.
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy at best. This unit is not for use by individuals over 200lbs. If you're light weight, this machine will meet your needs
customer_reviews.author: panik nazarian

customer_reviews.title: Use the PDF version due to the product being updated.
customer_reviews.text: The screw for part 2 of the instructions does not fit, the screws are very long and anti loose nuts does not fit the screw. They are two big! However, the company told me this was due to the product being update and to use the PDF version. Other then that, I love the the Tower.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Timberlake

customer_reviews.title: good home gym quality
customer_reviews.text: Very easy assembly. Good overall quality. Nice height adjustment feature.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole M.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but the cheapest!
customer_reviews.text: Not the best but was the cheapest! Not super sturdy and the model in pictures must be about 5 foot tall as it looks bigger then it actually is.
customer_reviews.author: JSO

customer_reviews.title: It wobbles as it won’t sit level which is a ...
customer_reviews.text: It wobbles as it won’t sit level which is a pain in the ass. But if you can get past that it does the job for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly advertised and adjustable for my daily inside use.
customer_reviews.text: The project came as requested in a timely manner. Easily assembled and set up inside, where I do have a low ceiling. Just what I needed. Use it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Terrible instructions
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, works well. 2 stars due to the instructions. They list the wrong parts / wrong steps which made the whole process of putting the thing together take twice as long as it should have, and made me question my sanity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Annoyed
customer_reviews.text: Hardware does not match pictures or description. Nuts and bolts do not fit together in a way that will make it possible to assemble this without a trip to the hardware store. The brand I got is different than others pictured so results could vary.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Fix the mislabeled instructions
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could try out the product as fast as I could but sadly I couldn’t, because of the instructions not matching the correct way to build the product being mislabeled making the build impossible at first glance. It’s not bad for what it is, not completely stable just a slight wobble but other than that its of great use put together. Looking forward to using it for future workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Purchase

customer_reviews.title: Not for taller people or so done who has a wide frame
customer_reviews.text: I'm 245 pounds. Do not use unless you have counter weights on the back. If you have a wide frame look for something else. I still use it and it serves it's purpose but have to take extra precautions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little shaky but fair for the price
customer_reviews.text: It’s not terrible but it’s not great. It’s a little shaky and I’m 185 lbs for reference. Considering the cost, it’s about what you would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Great workout device
customer_reviews.text: Ainfox did a great job contacting me letting me know the item was delayed, but I wasn’t worried as during covid times many things are delayed. The tower works great and matches my other equipment. It was easy to assemble and is very stable.
customer_reviews.author: bt

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: My pullup bar assembly has alot of play in it, even after being tightened down. I weigh 240, and the whole thing flexes during pullups. I have the same problem with dips, but it isn't as obvious. I don't believe this has a 550lb capacity.
customer_reviews.author: J S Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with instructions and missing a washer
customer_reviews.text: First, instructions pictures and part numbers did not match with accessories package, second, there was no note to leave components very loose until last piece (had to go back and loose them), and finally a washer was missing, instead of 12 I got 11, so had to go to hardware store to get one...
customer_reviews.author: Jose Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Nice pull up equipment
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product and I use it all the time. Simple assembly, overall price is appropriate, suitable for family use.
customer_reviews.author: Johny

customer_reviews.title: Still waiting to try it out.
customer_reviews.text: Stuff hangs off of it, very well. Good for shirts. Really is well made. But the area I chose to set it up in, is lacking enough head room to make to truely useable.
customer_reviews.author: Chester

customer_reviews.title: Its worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm very happy with my power tower, I'm using it almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Base is not heavy enough or long/wide enough. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Base is not heavy enough or long/wide enough. I am a fit 210lb Male and it wobbles on dips. That being said it is strong and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Got my tower power yesterday. I assembled today but there r two pieces missing. I tried to contact the seller but Amazon is not letting me. I would give 5 stars because it looks nice a solid but now I have to look out there for the missing pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Quesada

customer_reviews.title: Great starter Dip station
customer_reviews.text: Great starter dip station. I'm 6'2" and this is perfectly adjustable for my height and could easily accommodate a 5' tall person or over 6 ft. Definitely worth the money for the price and quality. Super easy assembly but would be faster if you use a socket with a drill.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It took a bit to assemble but it’s very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: azyogamom

customer_reviews.title: Performs well for athletes
customer_reviews.text: My kids are in jiu jitsu and compete! This has been perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Power Tower
customer_reviews.text: This Power Tower is GREAT! No missing pieces & it is very firm. And to make sure you use your home tool to tight the bolts. The tool from package is no good but I used my home tool instead.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Poor directions and feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t recommend. Directions where not great and confusing. It feels kind of cheap overall. I wish I spent a little more and got something nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate!
customer_reviews.text: So much fun! Easy to assemble, my nine year old and eight year old helped me! Lightweight and shockingly sturdy. There was a misprint and the company had it corrected and had clear guidelines on the errors. Absolutely pleased with the purchase so far!
customer_reviews.author: Hailey Smits

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Shaky, not very stable, but serviceable and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Karina  Burman

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Love working out on this thing. Since I travel often, I don't get time for the gym. So, this comes in handy when I'm on rush mode. Kind of creaky, but I don't mind.
customer_reviews.author: Romani

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh
customer_reviews.text: I hated putting this thing together. All the parts are label wrong. I actaully thought I was missing pieces. Lot less sturdy then I imagine. Lets see how it goes
customer_reviews.author: juan

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to put it together. It came with the wrong size bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Station
customer_reviews.text: Does what it states, only issue is unit rocks on dips.
customer_reviews.author: finergyglobal1

product_meta.title: Ainfox Power Tower, Capacity 550 Lbs Pull Up Bar Tower Dip Stands Fitness Gym Office
feature_bullets: Handles have grips for non-slip workouts;Weight capacity: 550LB
Made of oblate reinforced steel frame,Sturdy construction & step-up design
Dimension: 30.7"(L)x 42.5"(W)x 84.7"(H), Height can be adjusted from 64.6" to 84.6"
Easy assembly;Training abdominal muscles,arm, back ,chest, shoulders and leg muscles
